basics.name: Leonardo Vezzani
basics.label: PhD Student - XR & Automotive (Research coordination & teaching)
basics.summary: PhD student in Computer and Multimedia Engineering with a strong focus on XR (AR/VR), simulation, and experimental research tools. Experienced in designing, implementing, and validating simulation-based workflows for automotive and human–machine interaction studies, with particular attention to reproducibility and methodological rigor. Actively involved in coordinating research activities, mentoring students, and supporting collaborative projects across academia and industry. Comfortable working hands-on with complex technical systems while contributing to experimental design, documentation, and long-term research infrastructure.

work.name: Politecnico di Torino
work.position: PhD Student – In-Car AR Head-Up Displays
work.summary: PhD research focused on AR interfaces for automotive head-up displays, with emphasis on VR-based testing and the development of standardized research tools using the CARLA driving simulator.
highlights: Designed and developed VR-based testing workflows for automotive AR HUD evaluation
Contributed to the creation of a standardized research tool built on CARLA
Worked closely with supervisors, students, and industry partners
Combined hands-on development with research planning and evaluation
